oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dr. Boyd's dentist office
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Browder, B.B., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Medical Profession
African American business enterprises; Dentists
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of wall-papered room with library table, rocker, bookshelves, wall-mounted telephone, and window on which "Dr. Boyd Dentist" is written in reverse. A doorway opens into an adjacent room.

Doctor C.S. Boyd had a successful dental practice on West Vine Street in Knoxville in the early decades of the twentieth century. This image shows a spacious suite of offices with handsome period furnishings and thick reference volumes resting on table and bookshelves, and a modern telephone.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: African American Photography Collection, MS.2129. University of Tennessee, Knoxville -- Libraries
